title: Ukraine - Subnational Administrative Boundaries
name: cod-ab-ukr
notes: Ukraine administrative level 0-4 boundaries (COD-AB) dataset version 04.   This dataset is structured into 4 levels: - Admin 1: 27 oblast (region) with three exceptions - Admin 2: 139 raion (district) with three exceptions - Admin 3: 1769 hromada (community) - Admin 4: 29707 populated place, settlement, or village, partial coverage   Dates associated with this dataset: - 01 January 2024: boundaries created by the source - 01 January 2024: last edit to the dataset before publishing - 16 April 2024: valid for use by the humanitarian community - 21 January 2025: dataset reviewed for accuracy and completeness - 22 October 2025: this metadata updated   Quality assured, configured, and published by HDX and OCHA Field Information Services (FIS).
license_title: Creative Commons Attribution for Intergovernmental Organisations (CC BY-IGO)
methodology_other: Dataset: Sourced from Ukraine Kartografia.  P-coding by OCHA and ITOS.
caveats:
The Ukrainian government has not fully implemented its new administrative structure reforms in the Autonomous Republic of Crimea [UA01] and Sevastopol [UA85]. Consequently, 31 ADM4 features within the Sevastopol ADM3 polygon retain P-codes that do not correctly conform to [UA85]. This will be rectified in a COD-AB update once the government has regained control of the Crimean Peninsula.

Note that limitations of the Ukrainian-to-Russian transliteration method mean that more than one Ukrainian name may be represented by a single Russian feature name.

Note that Ukraine COD data incorrectly uses 'UA' instead of 'UK' in Ukrainian language name fields.  For instance, "Admin1_UA" should be "Admin1_UK".

As of January 2025, there are no legislative regulations that officially define the renaming of hromadas following the renaming of their capitals. Technically, such hromadas still retain their old names, even though their capitals now have new ones. However, the draft law (https://mtu.gov.ua/news/36152.html) has already been prepared to address this collision. It is expected that the hromadas' names will soon be aligned with the new names of their capitals. Therefore, the supposed new names of hromadas are reflected in the reference table.
